name: sprawl

sprawl verb
(BODY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I ] to spread the arms and legs out carelessly and untidily while sitting or lying down: I knocked into her in the corridor and sent her sprawling (= knocked her over).

sprawl verb
(CITY)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] (especially of a city) to cover a large area of land with buildings, especially gradually over a period of time: The refugee camps sprawl across the landscape.
